DOC.brief_title: Dairy Modulation Oxidative Inflammatory Stress Overweight Obese Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity associate sub-clinical chronic oxidative inflammatory stress , major contributor obesity-associated co-morbidities . Calcitriol ( 1 , 25- ( OH ) 2-D3 ) regulate adipocyte lipid metabolism , dietary calcium inhibits obesity suppression calcitriol . We recently show calcitriol increase oxidative stress stimulate expression release inflammatory cytokine , inhibit expression release anti-inflammatory cytokine . We also show inhibition calcitriol high calcium diet decrease adipose tissue systemic oxidative inflammatory stress mouse model obesity . Moreover , dairy exert great effect oxidative inflammatory stress . These mouse also exhibit significant reduction adiposity , could lead confounding , reduction independently reduce oxidative inflammatory stress . However , support cellular/mechanistic data indicate effect independent adiposity reduction . Consequently , propose low calcium diet exacerbate oxidative inflammatory stress high dairy diet attenuate independently change adiposity , thereby significantly reduce risk obesity-associated co-morbidities . Accordingly , objective study determine acute effect dairy-rich diet oxidative inflammatory stress overweight obese subject absence change adiposity . Twenty subject ( 10 obese 10 overweight ) undergo randomize crossover study low dairy high dairy eucaloric diet . Each dietary period four week , two dietary period separate four-week washout period . Primary outcome circulate index oxidative stress inflammation . Secondary outcome include blood pressure , circulate glucose , insulin , lipid , calcium-regulatory hormone body composition .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index ( BMI ) 2529.9 ( n=10 ) ; 3034.9 kg/m2 ( n=10 ) Age 1850 year Weight stable : 3 kg weight loss past three month BMI < 25 > 35 Type II diabetes require use oral antidiabetic agent and/or insulin ( confound effect ROS ) Adverse response study food ( lactose intolerance , dairy intolerance , dairy allergy ) ; determine selfreport . history presence significant metabolic disease could impact result study ( i.e . endocrine , hepatic , renal disease ) history eat disorder presence active gastrointestinal disorder malabsorption syndrome pregnancy lactation use obesity pharmacotherapeutic agent within last 6 month use overthecounter antiobesity agent ( e.g . contain phenylpropanalamine , ephedrine and/or caffeine ) within last 6 month Recent ( current past 12 week ) use psychotropic medication Recent ( past four week ) initiation exercise program Recent ( past twelve week ) initiation hormone replacement therapy change HRT regimen Recent ( past twelve week ) initiation hormonal birth control change hormonal birth control regimen Recent ( current past 12 week ) history smoking
